question: Write a letter to the council about new sports and facilities in the comunity
text: I am writing on behalf of residents from Area “A” concerning the funding for a range of new sports and fitness facilities for young people. We are impressed with the council’s plan and appreciate the opportunity to share our ideas. The public sports facilities have played an important role in improving residents’ health and welfare and overall quality of life. The most important is the youth crime rate in our area has increased every year, so this new facility can be a safe place for teenagers to gather and do activities.

Our main suggestion is “Indoor Court”. From the residents’ survey was found that 75% agree that Indoor Court is the most beneficial and useful for the community. It is easy to convert to multipurpose. Many types of sports can be played on indoor courts such as basketball, volleyball, badminton, and possibly convention. Furthermore, because it is temperature controlled, it provides more opportunities for residents to stay active throughout the year and under all types of weather. After all, we believe that the new indoor court is a worthy investment for our area and provide an advantage not only for children but also for all ages residents.

We would appreciate it if you will consider our suggestion and would be grateful if you could proceed with this or have any further community discussion. We are looking forward to hearing from you soon.
